params.owner: Address to add as a valid owner.

isInitialized(address).details: Returns if the module was already initialized for a provided smartaccount

isModuleType(uint256).details: Returns boolean value if module is a certain type

params.moduleTypeId: the module type ID according the ERC-7579 spec MUST return true if the module is of the given type and false otherwise

returns._0: True if the owner is registered for the account.

params.data: Additional signature payload supplied by the caller.
params.hash: Hash of the signed message being validated.
params.sender: Address that triggered the validation on the account.

returns._0: Selector indicating whether the signature is valid.

onInstall(bytes).details: This function is called by the smart account during installation of the module

params.data: arbitrary data that may be required on the module during `onInstall` initialization MUST revert on error

onUninstall(bytes).details: This function is called by the smart account during uninstallation of the module

params.data: arbitrary data that may be required on the module during `onUninstall` de-initialization MUST revert on error

params.owner: Address of the owner to revoke.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`. See the corresponding https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[ERC section] to learn more about how these ids are created. This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.details: Validates a transaction on behalf of the account. This function is intended to be called by the MSA during the ERC-4337 validation phase Note: solely relying on bytes32 hash and signature is not sufficient for some validation implementations (i.e. SessionKeys often need access to userOp.calldata)

params.userOp: The user operation to be validated. The userOp MUST NOT contain any metadata. The MSA MUST clean up the userOp before sending it to the validator.
params.userOpHash: The hash of the user operation to be validated

addOwner(address).notice: Grant ownership access to an EOA for the caller's account.

isOwnerOf(address,address).notice: Check if an address is a registered owner of a smart account.

isValidSignatureWithSender(address,bytes.notice: Validate an ERC-1271 signature with context about the original sender.

onInstall(bytes).notice: Adds the provided owners for the installing account.

onUninstall(bytes).notice: Removes the provided owners when the validator is uninstalled.

removeOwner(address).notice: Remove an existing owner from the caller's account.
